topics.body:
So I'm going to fail C++ again cause my teacher's a egotistical prick who simply can't be bothered to even so much as grade our work or even spend five minutes towards the students and spends 95% of the time just doing jack shit and hanging out with his friend.

The joke is on them; I'm taking a semester off to learn the programming languages from my brother who is way more intelligent than any of my teachers.  Since they've been such pricks I'm going to come back in summer and be like "Where do I see myself in five years?  TAKING YOUR JOB!"

If they were at least intelligent or such I could understand, but I've had a week long argument with one of my teachers trying to explain to him basic math before and why his equation was utter bullshit.

Random question: isn't understanding math kind of a requirement for programming?
